coverage_notes: Comprehensive coverage of top 205 most common fiction/romance/fantasy/thriller/sci-fi tags across 7 categories

second-chances.notes: Romance trope: characters get another opportunity at love or life

enemies-to-lovers.notes: Romance trope: initial hostility turning into love

phrases: best friends who fall in love
friends-to-lovers.notes: Romance trope: friendship developing into romance

forbidden-love.notes: Romance trope: love that defies rules or norms

phrases: two people fighting for one person's love
love-triangle.notes: Romance trope: three people in a romantic conflict

age-gap-romance.notes: Romance trope: lovers with significant age difference

phrases: very different people fall in love
opposites-attract.notes: Romance trope: individuals with contrasting traits fall in love

phrases: fake it til you make it
fake-relationship.notes: Romance trope: pretend relationship becomes real

forced-proximity.notes: Romance trope: forced to be together leads to romance

phrases: knew each other when they were young
childhood-friends.notes: Romance trope: childhood connection leads to adult romance

phrases: grumpy character softened by cheerful partner
grumpy-sunshine.notes: Romance trope: grumpy character paired with sunny optimist

brother-best-friend.notes: Romance trope: romance with sibling's best friend

single-parent.notes: Romance element: character is a single parent

family-drama.notes: Common theme: intense family conflicts or secrets

coming-of-age.notes: Common theme: protagonist's growth from youth to adulthood

identity.notes: Common theme: exploration of self or identity

grief.notes: Common theme: dealing with loss and mourning

redemption.notes: Common theme: atoning for past wrongs

betrayal.notes: Common theme: character betrayed by someone trusted

sacrifice.notes: Common theme: character makes significant sacrifice

loyalty.notes: Common theme: strong loyalty between characters

survival.notes: Common theme: characters fighting to survive

class-differences.notes: Romance/drama theme: lovers from different social classes

small-town.notes: Setting: stories set in small towns or villages

big-city.notes: Setting: stories set in major urban centers

rural.notes: Setting: stories set in countryside or rural areas

school.notes: Setting: stories set in academic institutions

military.notes: Setting: stories involving military environments or characters

abuse.notes: Content warning: emotional or physical abuse

mental-health.notes: Content warning: depiction of mental health issues

strong-female-lead.notes: Character type: female protagonist with agency

phrases: hero who didn't want to fight
reluctant-hero.notes: Character type: hero who is initially unwilling

anti-hero.notes: Character type: protagonist with questionable morality

chosen-one.notes: Character type: protagonist chosen by destiny

mentor-figure.notes: Character type: wise mentor supporting the protagonist

unreliable-narrator.notes: Narrative device: narrator who can't be trusted

portal.notes: Fantasy trope: portal to another world

time-travel.notes: Sci-fi element: characters travel through time

phrases: after the end of the world
post-apocalyptic.notes: Science Fiction setting: world after an apocalypse

magic-school.notes: Fantasy setting: school for magic users

phrases: start as enemies but become friends
